Working with View Manager

A flexible utility, View Manager can be used in a variety of situations on the Cross-Platform client in which it is desirable to merge views. The following procedure provides a high-level overview of how you might use the View Manager graphical user interface.

Note: You must have JRE 1.3 on your workstation to use View Manager.

To work with View Manager:

  1. From the menu bar, select View > View Manager. After you launch View Manager, the StarTeam main window may retain focus. If this occurs, minimize this window.

  2. Select source and target objects. See Selecting Source and Target Objects.

  3. Select Tools > Options to set options for one or more types of run operations. Options can be set for the following operations:

    • Source-to-target

    • Bidirectional

    • Missing-objects-only

    • Copy-to-target

    The options specify the scope of the source and target objects, what data to replicate, how to handle files that need to be merged, whether to lock the server, etc

  4. (Optional) If desired, save these options to a properties file using File > Save. See Creating and Using Properties Files.

  5. Perform a preview operation to see whether the results of your operation will be as expected and whether you need to adjust your option settings prior to performing synchronization. The copy-to-target operation does not have a preview, because unexpected behavior is less likely.

  6. Review the files that need to be merged with a comparison utility. (Files cannot be merged at this time.)

  7. Locate locked files (if you are not breaking locks), and ask users to unlock them before the synchronization process begins.

  8. Run the synchronization or copy-to-target operation. See Performing Synchronization Operations or Performing Copy-to-Target Operations.

  9. After the operation completes, locate the files that need to be merged. To locate the files, do one of the following:

    • Select Find > Next Manual Merge and/or Find > Previous Manual Merge from the menu bar.

    • Click the Next Manual Merge button or the Previous Manual Merge button on the toolbar.

  10. Merge the files, as required, with a merge utility.
